channel.title: Im starting C++
channel.description: hello people, I am starting to learn C++ programming. Can anyone post what I need to get started, such as, compiler, linker, etc., please post a download link if available. Im not asking to be spoonfed, but just like a starter packet :P, tutorials, links, downloads, anything. Im a great learner and know some Java already so, how hard could it be? lol. also, add my msn, tmanjones@hotmail.com, and we can talk about this. Please dont post things like, 'your gonna fail.' or 'you cant do this.', cuz i will do this and i will not fail. Thanks, Cooldude12

is that site any good i got it from my friend.
[/quote]Perhaps you should take a look at it.

i did but i know absolutely nothing about c++ so how am i suppose to know if it is good…[/quote]

Start off with the tutorials, duh

item.title: Im starting C++
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

About IDE/Compiler:
Bloodshed Dev C++ is the easiest for getting started.
MSVC++ is the best free windows IDE / compiler ( http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-gb/vstudio/aa700736.aspx )

About learning:
To learn C++, the best thing is a good book. “Accelerated C++, practical programming by example” seems to be quite good, and you can probably find a link somewhere on the net. (If you can’t, send me a PM on IRC some time that I’m online).

Read full topic

item.title: Im starting C++
item.dc:creator: @cooldude12 cooldude12
item.description:
@cooldude12 wrote:

hello people, I am starting to learn C++ programming. Can anyone post what I need to get started, such as, compiler, linker, etc., please post a download link if available. Im not asking to be spoonfed, but just like a starter packet :P, tutorials, links, downloads, anything. Im a great learner and know some Java already so, how hard could it be? lol. also, add my msn, tmanjones@hotmail.com, and we can talk about this. Please dont post things like, ‘your gonna fail.’ or ‘you cant do this.’, cuz i will do this and i will not fail.
Thanks,
Cooldude12
